publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4750 Alasdair Morgan: Statue of James Clerk Maxwell—That the Parliament notes the Royal Society of Edinburgh’s plans for a statue of James Clerk Maxwell in Edinburgh; commends it for its suggestion that the Parliament could provide an ideal site for such a statue; notes that the society does not seek public funding for the project, only a suitable location, and considers a site within the Parliament’s precincts to be an ideal venue for such a statue.
S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Stewart Stevenson*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-4750 Alasdair Morgan: Statue of James Clerk Maxwell—That the Parliament notes the Royal Society of Edinburgh’s plans for a statue of James Clerk Maxwell in Edinburgh; commends it for its suggestion that the Parliament could provide an ideal site for such a statue; notes that the society does not seek public funding for the project, only a suitable location, and considers a site within the Parliament’s precincts to be an ideal venue for such a statue. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop

S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Fergus Ewing*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*, Rob Gibson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Richard Lochhead*, Alex Neil*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Ms Sandra White*, Alex Fergusson*

S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Patrick Harvie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Phil Gallie*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-4750 Statue of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 5 September 2006) Scott Barrie*
